sentences.sentence: Reports of fresh shelling in Melitopol as residents and soldiers in liberated Kherson reflect on Russia's occupation.

sentences.sentence: Serbian and Kosovan leaders are expected in Brussels today to find a solution with the car registration crisis as tensions increase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian-occupied Melitopol in Ukraine's Zaporizhia region is the latest district to come under attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to Mayor Ivan Fedorov, three explosions were heard in the village of Vizela.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This comes as Nikopol on the banks of the Dnipro River was also hit by Russian shelling overnight.

Tensions have increased since the start of implementing the plans to register Serbian number plates in Kosovo at the beginning of the month. It's part of a gradual move to ban Serbian number plates in Kosovo totally by April next year. And now drivers could be fined. Brussels has tried to decrease tensions between the two countries, fearing an escalation in ethnic violence. One of the requirements to become fully signed up EU members is to resolve bilateral issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Delegates attending the COP27 climate summit are heading home with mixed feelings about what was achieved in Egypt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A landmark deal was reached to set up a loss and damage fund, but there was no additional progress on efforts to limit global emissions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A weary COP president lauded the fund, bringing the summit, which overran by two days, to a close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My friends, we heard the calls and we responded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Today here in Sharm el-Sheikh we established the first ever dedicated fund for loss and damage, a fund that has been so long in the making.

sentences.sentence: Richer nations will pay those vulnerable to climactic disasters due to global warming for damage and economic losses but there have been no new pledges reducing fossil fuels and the inclusion of so-called low emissions energy has raised fears that some fuels such as as natural gas, could be considered green.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

At the end of COP27, climate experts warn the world still stands on the brink of climate catastrophe and cutting greenhouse gas emissions remains the only answer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Residents of Equatorial Guinea are voting in presidential and parliamentary polls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The world's longest-serving president, Teodora Ibiang-Negelmo Mbassago, is seeking re-election at the age of 80.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: After 43 years of power, he has a strong grip on the oil-rich nation, with family members in key government roles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Observers consider the elections as merely cosmetic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Continuous rain in western Albania has flooded hundreds of hectares of land, temporarily cutting power supplies to some areas and forcing families to evacuate. A car with three people in it was reported missing on Sunday after being caught in fast-running waters, as well as a 50-year-old man and his son. Emergency services and the army are on alert as rain is expected to continue Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The countdown to Christmas has begun with the festive light displays being launched in cities across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Paris is among them, but this year the French capital will go dark hours earlier than usual due to the energy crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Further energy-saving measures include ditching seasonal ice rinks for roller skating and a general scaling back with illuminations an encyclopedia for three worlds believed to be the first ever multilingual encyclopedia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: is currently helping ukrainian children to integrate fully into the italian school system it has eight volumes and each entry is presented in Italian, English and Ukrainian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's intended for primary school children, but its main aim is to help Ukrainian pupils feel fully accepted in the classroom with their new classmates and teachers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The idea was born from a concrete need. We asked ourselves how, in our small way, we could give our contribution to the school education and cultural integration of the newcomers of Ukrainian children who came to Italy and Europe it has hundreds of topics conveyed to children of different origin through not only books but also interactive content audiobooks smartphones and multimedia interactive blackboards for instance we started from the solar system analyzing whating what the sun is, and this is written in Italian, English and Ukrainian.

sentences.sentence: We've talked about it and then we use the book to study the eclipses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is in places like this that the concept of integration turns into something real and concrete.

sentences.sentence: In this primary school in Bologna, Ukrainian children have the chance to keep using their language to study and learn, thanks to a simple but brilliant idea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: All over Italy, dozens of schools and about 500 public libraries have adopted the trilingual encyclopedia. Integration and inclusion go through precious tools like this one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The England team will begin their quest towards World Cup glory on Monday. The three Lions will take on Iran in their opening game at the Khalifa Stadium. Manager Gareth Southgate has confirmed that the squad will take the knee before kick-off, an anti-racism gesture the team have practised since the death of George Floyd in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: England's captain Harry Kane was planning on wearing a one-love armband, but due to threats of fines by FIFA, the English, Welsh and seven other teams dropped the plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's another blow to promoters for diversity and inclusion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, rivals Iran are competing on the biggest global stage with a third time in a row.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In other games in Group B, Wales are about to make their first appearance at a World Cup final in 64 years, when they face the US later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Group A, the Netherlands will take on Africa's highest-ranking team, Senegal, at their opening clash. Euronews reporter Sam Ashu has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The other match in Group A sees Senegal take on the Netherlands and it's a Senegal side who will be without Sadio Mane who played such a key role in their African Cup of Nations win earlier this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Instead the manager Aliu Sissi will be relying on Ismail Issa as his side's main attacking threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As for the Netherlands, well they're back in sports biggest competition, having missed out four years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In fact they're arguably the biggest side never to have lifted the FIFA World Cup trophy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These two sides are favourites to progress to the knockout stages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This particular match could have a huge say on who wins Group A.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sam Eshoo for Euronews in Doha.
